titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania LJS 204: Shesh kenafayim

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts LJS 204: Shesh kenafayim are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

Metadata is © and licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution License version 4.0 (CC-BY-4.0 https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/legalcode. For a description of the terms of use see the Creative Commons Deed https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/.

notesStmt.note: Title supplied by cataloger; English translation is Six wings; also known as Kanfe nesharim (Wings of eagles).

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Introduction and compilation in 6 divisions of astronomical tables concerning the movements of the sun and moon, solar and lunar eclipses, and the day of the new moon, calculated for the Jewish calendar and the longitude and latitude of Tarascon, Provence, the home of the author.

supportDesc.extent: 27 leaves : 164 x 116 (111 x 81) mm. bound to 172 x 127 mm

layoutDesc.layout: Text written in 24 long lines and frame-ruled in lead with double outer bounding line; tables in various formats ruled in brown ink.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in Italian Hebrew square and cursive script by Joseph ben Isaac Gallico (f. 5v) and possibly another hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Red and brown ink used in tables.

binding.p: Modern half calf over marbled boards.

origin.p: Written in Italy, dated 3 Av [20 July] 1509 (f. 5v).

history.provenance: Formerly owned by David Solomon Sassoon; sold by his family as part of his collection at auction at Sotheby's, 12 May 1981, lot 2.
Sold at auction at Swann Galleries, 19 Dec. 1991, lot 161.
Sold by Martayan Lan, cat. 11 (1994), no. 60, to John D. Stanitz (Cleveland, Ohio), Ms. 35.
Acquired by Lawrence J. Schoenberg with other Stanitz manuscripts, Sept. 1997.
Gift of Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle Schoenberg, 2015.
